nodes.text: An e-nursery retail website that integrates clustering-based recommendation and visual data representation will improve accessibility, user experience, and business operations for plant nurseries and customers
The platform addresses limited online accessibility and sparse digital resources for plant enthusiasts and expands nurseries' reach to customers
Gathered datasets include a plant database (species, attributes, pricing), customer information (demographics, purchase and search history, site usage), and product feedback (reviews and ratings)
Prepared and cleaned customer and product data prior to analysis (data preparation and preprocessing)

Implemented a personalized recommendation system using clustering algorithms (examples given: K-means, hierarchical clustering) to group similar users and generate product suggestions based on cluster membership
Implemented standard e-commerce features including secure payment gateway integration, shopping cart functionality, product availability updates, registration/login and checkout flow
Developed and demonstrated graphical user interfaces: login, registration, home, add-to-cart, checkout, payment receipt pages (GUI screenshots provided)
Observed recommendation example in the implemented system: user who added Piper Betel Maghal received Aloe vera as a recommended plant
Clustering groups users with similar preferences and behaviors, enabling recommendation generation from cluster-level product associations

Prior literature reports that k-means, ordered clustering, hybrid and deep embedding approaches improve recommendation accuracy, mitigate cold-start and data sparsity, and support personalized e-commerce recommendations

Connected project database to visualization tools (Tableau, Matplotlib) and created dashboards to display sales trends, customer demographics, and product popularity with interactive filters and drill-downs
Data visualization makes complex project data more understandable and accessible, supporting stakeholder insights, informed decision-making, inventory management and marketing strategy

Conclusion: Integrating clustering-based recommendations and visual data representation produces a user-friendly, data-driven e-nursery platform that can enhance shopping experience, customer engagement, and operational efficiency
Project outputs are demonstrated mainly via system design and GUI screenshots; no quantitative evaluation metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, user study results) are reported
Assumes availability and sufficiency of user data (purchase history, search history, demographics, reviews) for effective clustering and recommendation generation
